meanings.definition: To raise or lift something up.
meanings.sent1: She was hoisting the flag up the pole.
meanings.sent2: The workers were hoisting the boxes onto the truck.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was hoisting the acorn up the tree with great effort.
meanings.sent4: The crane hoisting the steel beams resembled a giant metal arm reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ship hoisting its sails filled the children's storybook.

meanings.definition: The act of lifting or raising something.
meanings.sent1: The hoisting of the heavy curtain revealed the stage.
meanings.sent2: The hoisting of the trophy marked the end of the competition.
meanings.sent3: The hoisting of the cake for the birthday surprise almost ended in disaster.
meanings.sent4: The hoisting of the flag symbolized the start of the event.
meanings.sent5: The hoisting of the banner caught everyone's attention at the parade.

meanings.definition: A mechanism for lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The hoisting of the engine required the use of a pulley system.
meanings.sent2: The hoisting of the piano onto the stage was done with a hydraulic lift.
meanings.sent3: The hoisting of the car for repairs was a fascinating sight for the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The hoisting of the anchor on the ship was done with precision and teamwork.
meanings.sent5: The hoisting of the crates onto the shelves was made easier with the new hoist.
